title: setProgress does not interpolate between frames
body:
Lottie on Android doesn't interpolate between two Frames when using the `setProgress(..)` method. It just "rounds" to the next full frame (e.g. different progress values lead to the same frame shown). [setProgress](https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-android/blob/master/lottie/src/main/java/com/airbnb/lottie/LottieDrawable.java#L680) does this rounding:
```
setFrame((int) MiscUtils.lerp(composition.getStartFrame(), composition.getEndFrame(), progress));
```

The iOS however seem to interpolate between Frames. And of course Lottie does this internally when the animation is played normally. Hence I think it should be possible for `setProgress` too ðŸ˜ƒ 

My usecase is to align the animation progress to a scroll state. See [this Stackoverflow article](https://stackoverflow.com/questions/55063434/align-android-lottie-animation-to-scrolling/55124308) for a visual representation of the problem.

A simpler way to reproduce the issue is to create a `ValueAnimator` and manually update the animation progress. The issue is not dependent on any specific animation.

```
val valueAnimator = ValueAnimator.ofFloat(0f, 1f)
valueAnimator.duration = 30000
valueAnimator.addUpdateListener { animation ->
    lottieAnimationView.progress = animation.animatedFraction
}
valueAnimator.start()
```

Any chance this could be supported by Lottie?
